alert.note: Alert for Clark; Greene (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 27 at 3:28PM EST until February 27 at 3:45PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EST FOR EASTERN CLARK AND NORTHEASTERN GREENE COUNTIES... At 328 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Springfield, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Springfield, South Charleston, Harmony, Lisbon, Brighton, South Vienna, Clifton, Buck Creek State Park, Pitchin, Springfield Municipal Airport, Hustead and Plattsburg. This includes I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 55 and 70. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EST for west central Ohio. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
